net.gree.asdk.api
Class Request

java.lang.Object
  net.gree.asdk.api.Request

public final class Request
extends java.lang.Object

Class that provides a request with an OAuth signature. By verifying the OAuth signature in a server which has received a request, it is authenticated in the server.

Since:
2.0.0
Author:
GREE, Inc.
See Also:
OAuth 1.0 (RFC5849)

Method Detail

oauth

public void oauth(java.lang.String url,
                  java.lang.String method,
                  HttpEntity entity,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers,
                  boolean sync,
                   listener)
Sends a request with an OAuth signature to an external server.

This method is asynchronous or synchronous. opensocial_app_id, opensocial_owner_id, and opensocial_viewer_id are always added to a query parameter.

  • opensocial_app_id ID of the accessed GREE application
  • opensocial_viewer_id ID of the user who has currently accessed the GREE application
  • opensocial_owner_id ID of the user who has installed the accessed GREE application
The following is an example of sending a GET request. 
 new GreeRequest.makeRequest("http://example.com?data=foobar", "GET", null, null, OnResponseCallback listener) {
        public void onResponse(HttpResponse response) {
                // user code...
        }
 });

Parameters:
url - URL to which a request will be sent
method - HTTP method (such as GET or POST)
entity - HTTP entity to be added to the request (Specify null if the entity is not required because the HTTP method is GET or DELETE, etc.)
headers - Parameter to be added to the HTTP header of the request
listener - Listener that processes the result

oauthGree

public void oauthGree(java.lang.String action,
                      java.lang.String method,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> queryParameters,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers,
                      boolean sync,
                       listener)
Sends a request to access GREE Platform API provided by GREE. This method is asynchronous.

Parameters:
action - Name of the API to be called
method - HTTP method (such as GET or POST)
queryParameters - Parameter to be passed to the API
listener - Listener that processes the result

oauthGree

public void oauthGree(java.lang.String action,
                      java.lang.String method,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> queryParameters,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> headers,
                      boolean sync,
                      boolean isSecure,
                       listener)
Sends a request to access GREE Platform API provided by GREE.

Parameters:
action - Name of the API to be called
method - HTTP method (such as GET or POST)
queryParameters - Parameter to be passed to the API
headers - additional request headers
sync - whether this request should be synchronous
isSecure - whether this request should use https
listener - Listener that processes the result

setNetworkDisabled

public static void setNetworkDisabled(boolean disabled)
Allow application to disable/enable networking. Used during development / test to simulate loss of network.

Parameters:
disabled - true if the network should simulate a down network.

isNetworkDisabled

public static boolean isNetworkDisabled()
Current fake network status. (for testing)

Returns:
true if the network is disabled, false otherwise
